channel.title: Installing Kubuntu as a dual boot with software RAID
channel.description: Alright. Here's the story. I've got two Western Digital 150gb drives in RAID 0. It's an NVIDIA nShield RAID controller, but it's a software raid setup, meaning, it boots into the NVIDIA RAID controller, which then initializes RAID and loads the operating system (currently Vista.) There is no physical controller on the motherboard, just the SATA cables plugged directly into it, at least I believe. My question is, can the Kubuntu partition manager handle resizing/creating partitions on software RAID?

item.title: Installing Kubuntu as a dual boot with software RAID
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Moparisthebest:

You realize that in the time it took you to type that sentence you could have typed ‘resize partition vista’ into google and had the answer you wanted, without waiting or making yourself look like an ass.

Ah but that requires work.

Lol. I know. Thanks for all the help guys, I’m going to try this out this weekend, I can’t risk doing it during the week (school projects, etc.), but I’ll be sure to tell you all how it goes.

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Kubuntu as a dual boot with software RAID
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Moparisthebest:

You said you have vista right? why not just use vista’s built in partition editor to resize vista’s partition.

It has a built in partition editor? I didn’t know that.

I’ll try it. Hope for the best.

Edit: Where would I find this partition editor? It’s not in the control panel and I cba to google.

Read full topic
item.source: Installing Kubuntu as a dual boot with software RAID

item.title: Installing Kubuntu as a dual boot with software RAID
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

The safest way of going about installing Kubuntu, and making sure your computer survives another 5 or 6 years. Is to uninstall Vista, and install Kubuntu in its place.

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Kubuntu as a dual boot with software RAID
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

Fluxbox wouldn’t look any different on Arch, and I say that out of experience. When I finally reinstall Arch, I’ll take a screenshot and show it to you.

item.title: Installing Kubuntu as a dual boot with software RAID
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

Download the iso from archlinux.org. Don’t be fooled by the “pacman” and “Arch” stuff - it’s a different version of Kubuntu, if a bit more raw.

Read full topic
